page.title: 05FARMING : SOUTH TYNESIDE
page.content: The villages of East Boldon and Cleadon Village are surrounded by a green belt area. Some of this land is farmland. Two farms are owned by the Church Commisioners. Mr.Sidney Gibson is the tenant of both these farms, one of which is called Yellowleas. All the farms adopt mixed methods. Yellowleas has 65 dairy cattle. Others keep beef cattle, pigs and chickens. Barley, hay, turnips and cabbages are also grown. The cattle are bought in at 5 months, fattened and sold at 14 months. The pigs are bought at 8 weeks and sold at 4-6 months. The farmers' biggest problem is preventing local people from stealing their arable crops.
